page.title: 12A FAMILY CONSTRUCTION FIRM
page.content: { Gwerngenny}in Kilpeck parish is a 90 acre farm, and also the centre for a family{construction business}employing 16 men - 4 mechanics, 10 machine drivers, 1 farmworker and 1 student. Of these, thirteen live locally and three away. The machines include bulldozers, JCB's, refuse compactors and low-loader lorries. These are used on building sites and for farmwork, road construction and waste disposal. The main area served is southwest Herefordshire and adjoining areas of Gwent, but the business also serves {County Council}refuse sites in the Redditch, Hereford, Ross, Pershore, Kidderminster and Bromsgrove areas. The farmland is mainly grass, but some roots are grown. Cattle are brought from another farm to be fattened, and fat lambs go to{Hereford Market}for slaughter.
